lexUnit.name: whine.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: complain in a feeble or petulant way.

sentence.text: ` But we can not escape , " they whined .
“ Come on , ” he whined .
` I ai n't going without my property , " Garty whined .
` Poor Ben hungry , " he whined .
` Stanislaus loves me for myself alone , " Babs whined .
At the back of the class Tommy was whining , ` Please Miss , please Miss . "
` Roger , " he whined , the tears falling down his fat , pasty face , ` how could she ?
` Master , " he whined , ` how can I help you ? "
` Oh , come on , " whined Jackie .
` You had to learn , Dolly , " whined the mother .
Then , two seconds later , just as he thought : ` I 'm afraid Miss Maitland is not available right now , " whined the voice .
` I do n't see why you care , " whined the headmaster .
` Please do n't , " whined the shopkeeper , but it was too late .
Chuck and Benny , her kids , whined that she was never home .
As it is , Mr Botero has been whining that too many of his real works are flooding the market .
She whined that he did n't love her .
Hector whined his impatience , bringing Theda back to herself with a start .
He was backing away as he whined his protest .
` Give us a bit of time , " whined Jackie 's voice .
All of a sudden , she whined something about me not knowing what I had done and she broke down into tears .
THE PUNK generation now spend half their time whining about the smothering blanket of baby boomer nostalgia .
They do n't sweat and whine about their condition , they do n't lie awake in the dark and weep for their sins . "
Revocation of all picnicking privileges , even though I whine about my health and name flowers in English until I 'm blue in the face .
Instead of whining about my memory I should be thanking my lucky stars I 'm alive at all . "
The other waitress whined about the increased work when Sharon explained what was happening but Blanche silenced her with a steely glare .
She was whining to him about how Eyas Securities had played this awful trick on her , how embarrassing it all was .
I do believe Fru Møller is angry with me ! ” the Colonel 's lady whined to her husband .
` I 'm sick of him whining to me about you .
He would sit up long into the night tearfully whining to Zimm about it and drinking Zimm 's home-brewed beer .
` It 's for the starving multitudes , " he whined through his matted beard , holding out the crock of gold in his blood-stained fingers .
She went to link her hands sympathetically through Lucie 's arm , but her father snatched his arm away , whining in a sarcastic , piping voice , ` 'We were going to pass a purse around ! "
Fitzormonde and Mowbray had always been soft , they could whine and moan that they had not been to blame , but Horne had agreed to Whitton 's plan and built a thriving business on the proceeds .
